Posts.Content: Hopefully after this year they will quietly put it to bed - a campaign that raises funds for cancer services that causes  so much upset and discomfort to people who have been through cancer -surely there must be a better way ???

Posts.Content: I totally agree , the campaign makes me shudder- although I can understand close family / friends offering to shave their heads in support of you at the time - random other people doing it to raise money really doesn't sit right with me -feels kind of insulting and patronising .

Posts.Title: Breast care nurses

Posts.Content: That's very poor -I would ring again .Also stopping your CBT surely that can be done alongside all that is happening but maybe adapted .I had to pay privately for CBT as there was a 9 month wait via mental health  services - my therapist has adapted input to support me through a pretty turbulent time due to possible secondary diagnosis .Can you challenge their decision to stop support ? If you have a local cancer charity they are usually pretty good and quick at offering support . Sometimes it's exhausting trying to get the support you need isn't it .
Posts.Title: Breast care nurses

Posts.Content: Hi - if you have not been given a number to ring  to speak to BC Nurses try the breast unit reception desk and ask for the Nurses number - it is usually separate You usually have to leave a message and they ring back -  as they are usually in appointments .Some teams have psychologists within the team for support but mine didn't .Best and quickest source of support is usually your nearest cancer support charity - Maggies ,Cancercare etc .Although obviously if your really struggling you may need support from GP also .Hope you feel better soon .
